str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To tear asunder, burst, rend. From dia and rhegnumi; to tear asunder.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A tunic, garment, undergarment. Of foreign origin; a tunic or shirt.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
